title: Introduction to the charlatan package
text: charlatan makes easy generate fake data missing entries. First, need run MissingDataProvider() make appropriate make_missing() call specifying data type generated. method picks random number (N) slots input make_missing vector picks N random positions replaced NA matching input class.

text: purposes package: Provider: type data can generated charlatan. example, providers phone numbers, addresses people’s names. Adding provider may involve single file, one file; single R6 class many R6 classes. title: Contributing to charlatan
text: heart charlatan BareProvider, class basic number text substitution used throughout package. non-locale providers inherit directly BareProvider: NumericsProvider inherits BareProvider providers locales, added logic locales BaseProvider.

title: Contributing to charlatan
text: providers locales inherit common provider (Parent Provider), example English (United States) AddressProvider (AddressProvider_en_US) inherits AddressProvider, inherits BaseProvider, inherits BareProvider: inheritance can define common functionality works locales, ability overwrite functionality works specific use-case. example: PersonProvider class (Parent Provider) methods: first_name last_name, Japanese locale PersonProvider (PersonProvider_ja_JP) inherits method also adds new kana methods: AddressProvider (Parent Provider) city address methods, AddressProvider New Zealand locale (PersonProvider_en_NZ) extra components Maori names.
code: BareProvider > BaseProvider > AddressProvider > AddressProvider_en_US library(charlatan) set.seed(2000) en <- PersonProvider_en_US$new() # English jp <- PersonProvider_ja_JP$new() # Japanese en$first_name() # Georgia #> [1] "Georgia" jp$first_name() # Haruka #> [1] "Haruka" jp$first_kana_name() #  カオリ #> [1] "カオリ" jp$last_kana_name() # コイズミ #> [1] "コイズミ"

text: add new locale loremIpsumProvider. loremIpsumProvider generates random words, letters paragraphs language used placeholder text. add language Klingon (locale: tlh) Provider. first add locale lorem-provider.R check locale exists : (yet) add available_locales.R file . create new file lorem-provider-tlh.R:
code: lorem_word_list_tlh <- c("'Igh'aDmegh", "DIron", "Da'lar","moQbID")   #' Lorem provider for Klingon (Klingon) #' #' Methods for Lorem Ipsum generation  #' Lorem Ipsum is a placeholder text commonly used to demonstrate the visual #' form of a document or a typeface without relying on meaningful content. #' @family tlh #' @export #' @examples #' x <- LoremProvider_tlh$new() #' x$word() #' x$words(3) #' x$words(6) #' x$sentence() #' x$paragraph() #' x$paragraphs(3) #' cat(x$paragraphs(6), sep = "\n") #' x$text(19) #' x <- LoremProvider_tlh$new(word_connector = " --- ") #' x$paragraph(4) LoremProvider_tlh <- R6::R6Class(   inherit = LoremProvider,   "LoremProvider_tlh",   public = list(     #' @field locale (character) the locale     locale = "tlh"   ),   private = list(     word_list = lorem_word_list_tlh   ) )

text: general put new logic data close used. need something one locale , place . re-using logic multiple locales one Provider? Consider logic go Parent Provider. Data generally goes private component R6 class:
code: ProviderName<- R6::R6Class(   "ProviderName",   inherit = BareProvider,   public = list(    # add new functions here     ),   active = list(   # this one is special, you probably don't need it     ),   private = list(   # here is where you place data   provider_ = 'ProviderName'     ) )

title: Creating realistic data
text: Charlatan creates realistic looking data. now seen examples high level low level APIs. maybe like see examples generating data specific use-cases? vignette . show create fake transactional data, fake health care (PII) data finally example plumber API returns fake data. first slight detour different ways faking data.

title: Creating realistic data
text: Simulation data (creating fake data looks realistic) always best option, options discuss first. use real data use pseudonomous anonymous data create dataset scratch Using real actual data great live systems. want actual data actual predictions actual inference. , however smart reduce data columns need. Using real actual data bad idea demonstration use-cases. Personal Identifyable Information (PII) sensitive data need handled care. Even strip away full names relatively easy pinpoint specific people basis several data points. Pseudonymous anonymous data safer way deal personal identifyable data. stripping away PII replacing values random values make harder link data back actual people. main pro using kind data keep data structure intact. relationship variables remain, can predictions/inference . quite lot work make data truly anonymous. need surprisingly little data de-anonomize data link back actual people. Creating fake dataset scratch relatively easy data small. Using build-functions likesample, runif, rnorm etc. doable. slightly faster using package. Using completely random values make difficult talk stakeholders, understand random values. also really lot work generate complex data many different columns.

what: Steps for creating realistic looking business transactional data
title: Creating realistic data
text: create products create orders combine two first create categories subcategories. specific {charlatan} package (different every store). imagine better idea data . example categories Shoes, Jeans Dresses. Shoes prefix starts 1, Jeans prefix starting 2, Dresses start 5. combine prefix random number consistent product ids ( idea clothing stores actually , looked neat). create orders price, product id, location. Orders also email address shipped address. Finally combine everything: Notice customer_name email completely unrelated. create customer ‘table’ like product table create bit structure.
code:
# setup fraudster_cl <- fraudster("en_US") n <- 5 set.seed(1235) # create product data products <- data.frame(   prefix = c(rep(1, 5), rep(2, 2), rep(5, 2)),   product_id = fraudster_cl$integer(n = 9, min = 1000, max = 9999),   main_category = c(rep("Shoes", 5), rep("Jeans", 2), rep("Dresses", 2)),   sub_category = c(     "Dress shoes", "Tennis shoes", "Boots", "Hiking boots", "Country & Western style boots",     "Regular fit", "Straight fit",     "Summer dress", "Evening gown"   ) ) ## when you have {dplyr} installed there are way cleaner ways to do this products$product_id <- as.integer(sprintf("%s%s", as.character(products$prefix), products$product_id)) products #>   prefix product_id main_category                  sub_category #> 1      1      12006         Shoes                   Dress shoes #> 2      1      17515         Shoes                  Tennis shoes #> 3      1      16826         Shoes                         Boots #> 4      1      13916         Shoes                  Hiking boots #> 5      1      13979         Shoes Country & Western style boots #> 6      2      23811         Jeans                   Regular fit #> 7      2      22250         Jeans                  Straight fit #> 8      5      59459       Dresses                  Summer dress #> 9      5      51427       Dresses                  Evening gown # create orders orders <- data.frame(   order_id = fraudster_cl$integer(n = n, min = 10000, max = 90000),   location_id = fraudster_cl$integer(n = n, min = 1, max = 5),   price_paid = fraudster_cl$integer(n = n, min = 1, max = 9900) / 100,   product_id = sample(products$product_id, size = n, replace = TRUE),   order_email = fraudster_cl$email(n = n),   customer_name = fraudster_cl$name(n = n),   shipping_address = fraudster_cl$address(n = n) ) # combine orders and transactions example_transactions <- merge(orders, products) ## reorder the columns to let it make more sense. example_transactions[, c("order_id", "location_id", "product_id", "main_category", "sub_category", "price_paid", "customer_name", "order_email", "shipping_address")] #>   order_id location_id product_id main_category                  sub_category #> 1    38900           5      13979         Shoes Country & Western style boots #> 2    82163           5      13979         Shoes Country & Western style boots #> 3    26387           2      16826         Shoes                         Boots #> 4    49425           1      17515         Shoes                  Tennis shoes #> 5    32062           4      17515         Shoes                  Tennis shoes #>   price_paid      customer_name                 order_email #> 1      68.89          Sal Klein          meghan99@group.com #> 2      21.13 Darnell Stiedemann dillon.bartoletti@gmail.com #> 3      74.89    Santana Langosh       wyman.brody@gmail.com #> 4      74.75      Earley Hickle howell.samantha@hotmail.com #> 5      31.19 Dr. Andra White MD     helmer.hayes@corwin.net #>                                           shipping_address #> 1                  05992 Dona Squares
Mooreview, MH 32273 #> 2                2481 Plummer Drive
Micaylatown, VA 45528 #> 3 86826 Zeke Lodge Apt. 861
East Saigeland, TN 70514-0551 #> 4                407 Herzog Pass

Towneton, MT 48453

title: Creating realistic data
text: simulate protected health information {charlatan}. use low level api. example also comes issue github. First setup: don’t list counties US (3007 ). use random word LoremProvider county. probably nicer wrap function. Generate single ‘record’ person: can also create medical records sequence custom function. following example create sequence events based date.
code: # setup the providers ap <- AddressProvider_en_US$new() pp <- PersonProvider_en_US$new() ip <- InternetProvider_en_US$new() lp <- LoremProvider_en_US$new() SSNP <- SSNProvider_en_US$new() dtp <- DateTimeProvider$new() np <- NumericsProvider$new() pnp <- PhoneNumberProvider_en_US$new()  set.seed(1235) prot_health <- list(   first_name = pp$first_name(),   last_name = pp$last_name(),   phone_number = pnp$render(),   fax_number = pnp$render(),   street = ap$street_address(),   zipcode = ap$postcode(),   email = ip$email(),   county = paste0(lp$word(), " county"),   SSN = SSNP$render(),   dob = as.Date(dtp$date_time_between("1930-01-01", "1990-12-31")),   # I've decided record number is an integer between 10000 - 99999   medical_record_number = np$integer(min = 10000, max = 99999),   ip_address = ip$ipv4() ) prot_health #> $first_name #> [1] "Efrem" #>  #> $last_name #> [1] "Schaden" #>  #> $phone_number #> [1] "243.246.1773" #>  #> $fax_number #> [1] "+68(4)7385942080" #>  #> $street #> [1] "2414 Howell Stravenue" #>  #> $zipcode #> [1] "54142" #>  #> $email #> [1] "alta70@gmail.com" #>  #> $county #> [1] "benefit county" #>  #> $SSN #> [1] "275-05-1676" #>  #> $dob #> [1] "1954-06-03" #>  #> $medical_record_number #> [1] 76973 #>  #> $ip_address #> [1] "133.80.147.164" #' Generate a bunch of dates in sequence gen_med_record <- function(date_value, events = 4, event_types = c("admission", "x-ray", "blood-test", "general exam")) {   days <- sort(np$integer(events, 1, 365))   result <- data.frame(     date = date_value + days   )   result$event <- sample(event_types, size = nrow(result), replace = TRUE)   result }  result <- gen_med_record(date_value = as.Date("2022-03-01"), events = 5) ## And add the generated data to this dataframe too result$medical_record_number <- prot_health$medical_record_number result$last_name <- prot_health$last_name result$date_of_birth <- prot_health$dob result #>         date        event medical_record_number last_name date_of_birth #> 1 2022-05-12   blood-test                 76973   Schaden    1954-06-03 #> 2 2022-05-14 general exam                 76973   Schaden    1954-06-03 #> 3 2022-10-03        x-ray                 76973   Schaden    1954-06-03 #> 4 2022-11-21        x-ray                 76973   Schaden    1954-06-03 #> 5 2023-02-09 general exam                 76973   Schaden    1954-06-03

title: Make Fake Data
text: charlatan makes fake data, inspired borrowing code Python’s faker (https://github.com/joke2k/faker) Make fake data : person names jobs phone numbers colors: names, hex, rgb credit cards DOIs numbers range distributions gene sequences geographic coordinates emails URIs, URLs, parts IP addresses coming … Possible use cases charlatan: Students classroom setting learning task needs dataset. People simulations/modeling need fake data Generate fake dataset users database actual users exist Complete missing spots dataset Generate fake data replace sensitive real data public release Create random set colors visualization Generate random coordinates map Get set randomly generated DOIs (Digital Object Identifiers) assign fake scholarly artifacts Generate fake taxonomic names biological dataset Get set fake sequences use test code/software uses sequence data Reasons use charlatan: Light weight, dependencies Relatively comprehensive types data, added Comprehensive set languages supported, added Useful R features creating entire fake data.frame’s

code: x <- fraudster() x$job() #> [1] "Corporate investment banker" x$name() #> [1] "Dr. Garey Hamill" x$color_name() #> [1] "Ivory"

title: ISBNProvider — ISBNProvider
text: International Standard Book Number - Provider. ISBN starts group code, English language ISBN-10 codes start 0 1, German language books start 3. see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISBN_registration_groups. Charlatan provide helpers , can supply prefix , instance want create Mexican ISBNs can supplying ISBN10 prefix 970, Andorra supply ISBN 13 prefix 97899920 (978 ISBN13, 99920 Andorra).

title: Lorem provider Arabic — LoremProvider_ar_AA
code: x <- LoremProvider_ar_AA$new() x$word() #> [1] "الصعداء" x$words(3) #> [1] "ولكسمبورغ" "بفرض"      "حالية"     x$words(6) #> [1] "الحكم"   "ذات"     "لبلجيكا" "لان"     "عرفها"   "قِبل"     x$sentence() #> [1] "بدارت الإمتعاض بمما المتاخمة على وانهاء." x$paragraph() #> [1] "العالمية الفرنسي حالية تمهيد تُصب المعاهدات وبعض نتيجة. الخاسر به دار و مسارح." x$paragraphs(3) #> [1] "بعلى بحث أفريقيا وحرمان. بسبب وبعض اتّجة بالسيطرة."                                                    #> [2] "بضرب بالمحور للجزر لعملة مسؤولية. السبب اعتداء المارق. الشّعبين وصغار موالية واتّجه."                   #> [3] "الخطّة مرمى وحتى. إعمار شرسة والفلبين ألمّ. ضمنها أخر فقامت تعديل شموليةً كما. ببعض ليرتفع ببحشد بتحدّي." cat(x$paragraphs(6), sep = "\n") #> العالمي وبحلول مشاركة أفريقيا بقسوة بكلّ. غضون اليابانية أدوات. #> الصينية وبدأت بالرّغم الشرق أملاً ماليزيا المارق. لليابان اعتداء ديسمبر عُقر وايرلندا سقطت عشوائية. غضون التقليدية المتاخمة ماليزيا ماشاء الله بكلّ. #> لدحر ووصف إتفاقية ثانية لكون كلّ ديسمبر. الحدود قررت تجهيز الأرض ليرتفع. #> بمباركة مما شعار استبدال. مسرح بانه انه وبداية والعتاد. الصعداء وانهاء بقسوة وإقامة وتنصيب الشرق العظمى. #> الصين الأوروبية بالجوي مقاطعة. عُقر قائمة لدحر اليميني الصينية بنقطة شمال. الساحة السيطرة الآخر للسيطرة. #> ولاتّساع حتى وباءت بولندا تطوير مايو الجنود. والحزب زهاء الساحة غرّة ببحشد ارتكبها جهة بشرية. x$text(19) #> [1] "التاريخ إتفاقية." x <- LoremProvider_ar_AA$new(word_connector = " --- ") x$paragraph(4) #> [1] "نفس --- ونتج --- اليميني --- جسيمة --- بحيث --- لفشل. --- جديدة --- وقام --- للسيطرة --- وعُرفت. --- ساعة --- ومطالبة --- وعُرفت --- التبرعات --- لغات --- الهجوم --- بأيدي."

code: x <- LoremProvider_el_GR$new() x$word() #> [1] "διαφήμιση" x$words(3) #> [1] "απλό"       "πεδία"      "δημιουργια" x$words(6) #> [1] "περιεχόμενα" "δεν"         "τις"         "στο"         "αποστηθίσει" #> [6] "δυστυχής"    x$sentence() #> [1] "θυμάμαι χρονοδιαγράμματος χρόνου αγοράζοντας." x$paragraph() #> [1] "σας λαμβάνουν σαν έξι που. ίδιο μου τα. πως εδώ μην εξοργιστικά ότι." x$paragraphs(3) #> [1] "ατόμου μέρος νόμιζες εξοργιστικά γνωρίζουμε αν. συνεχώς τη ναι μια χαρτιού στα πως στήλες."       #> [2] "στα πετούν κύκλο παραδοτέου φίλος συνεχώς. της την να δημιουργήσεις."                             #> [3] "άτομο λιγότερο απομόνωση τρόποι. κάνεις δύο πάρεις αποστηθίσει για της. άρα γειτονιάς εκτελέσει." cat(x$paragraphs(6), sep = "\n") #> μου θα μη ένας μην. τον εδώ δύο πλέον κανείς ρωτάει. #> κι εφαρμογής φίλος απαραίτητο τα ας για. περιεχόμενα γιαυτό πρώτοι τα μου εκτελέσεις από. #> εδώ ταξινομεί πλέον θέλεις υόρκη. διακοπή μας βουτήξουν έστελνε σε. ποια από πάντα αφήσεις κι όχι. #> όσο διαφήμιση μα σας πολύ ως μέχρι μπουν. τις θέματα άρα χαρακτηριστικών συνέχεια σαν. #> σας οι πως εγώ ορίστε άρα τους δε. εφαρμογή τρέξει μη ανταγωνιστής οι. γραφικά γράψει άπειρα από στα ποσοστό έρθει. #> μας μάτσο τρόπο σίγουρος εδώ παραδοτέου. σε νόμιζες χρησιμοποιούσες. κρατήσουν κώδικα μια ανταγωνιστής νέα. x$text(19) #> [1] "Τα ήδη ναι." x <- LoremProvider_el_GR$new(word_connector = " --- ") x$paragraph(4) #> [1] "διευθυντές --- στη --- οι --- εδώ --- δε. --- ειδικά --- συγγραφείς --- πηγαίου --- εκτελείται. --- θα --- εταιρείες --- νέου --- μας --- σαν --- πετάξαμε. --- δυστυχώς --- ζητήσεις --- στα --- ίδιο --- δωροδοκηθούν --- ένας. --- άτομο --- γειτονιάς --- παραγωγικής --- διασφαλίζεται --- τις."

charlatan — charlatan-package
text: Make fake data, supporting addresses, person names, dates, times, colors, coordinates, currencies, digital object identifiers (DOIs), jobs, phone numbers, DNA sequences, doubles integers distributions within range.

title: charlatan — charlatan-package
text: ch_generate(): generate data.frame fake data fraudster(): single interface fake data methods High level interfaces: high level functions prefixed ch_ wrap low level interfaces, meant easier use provide easy way make many instances thing. Low level interfaces: R6 objects user can initialize call methods .

title: charlatan — charlatan-package
text: Roel M. Hogervorst hogervorst.rm@gmail.com Scott Chamberlain Kyle Voytovich Martin Pedersen

title: charlatan — charlatan-package
code: # generate individual types of data ch_name() #> [1] "Dr. Job Raynor PhD" ch_phone_number() #> [1] "070.087.3124x5939" ch_job() #> [1] "Sub"  # generate a data.frame ch_generate() #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    name                  job                         phone_number        #>    <chr>                 <chr>                       <chr>               #>  1 Emma Abbott PhD       Public librarian            (232)230-2847       #>  2 Deangelo Stanton      Air cabin crew              1-926-376-7152      #>  3 Dr. Bliss Dickinson   Building control surveyor   (404)673-6003x34435 #>  4 Bena Wuckert          Engineer, land              902-068-5906x97034  #>  5 Orvis Weissnat        Engineer, building services 604.074.0862x24194  #>  6 Nanette Kohler        Probation officer           726-129-4270x28623  #>  7 Darin Durgan          Energy manager              657.178.4982        #>  8 Millie Bahringer      Airline pilot               854-078-1425x6042   #>  9 Dr. Rosey Watsica MD  Secondary school teacher    +34(9)9200345364    #> 10 Mrs. Courtney Lind MD Publishing copy             385-631-0667x312     # one interface to all data types - generate the class first #  reports the locale to be used, can change optionally (x <- fraudster()) #> <fraudster> #>   locale: en_US x$job() #> [1] "Financial adviser" x$name() #> [1] "Ms. Jessie Pouros DDS" x$color_name() #> [1] "AliceBlue" x$hex_color() #> [1] "#832436"  # low level interfaces to "data providers" # these are exported by hidden from package man page # as most users will likely not interact with these x <- ColorProvider_en_US$new() x$color_name() #> [1] "FloralWhite" x$hex_color() #> [1] "#F9CA7B"

One greatest strengths charlatan, spirit brothers faker (python) faker (perl), ability customize realistically looking data many locales. easy add locales different en_US. release aims make easier add new locales favorite data types.

title: charlatan 0.6.1
text: Previous versions {charlatan} used special logic load locale-specific data, worked great, requires every locale use naming conventions required lot work across locales provider needed change one locale. Since version 0.6.0, locale specific Providers inherit Parent provider basic functionality Provider type, specific functions locale moved locale. example, Spongebob Squarepants, addresses required fruit street name, now possible overriding address function spongebob squarepants locale . See revamped contributing vignette info.

title: charlatan 0.6.1
text: Added new vignette detailed examples data simulation. new baseclass BareProvider creates selection fill-functions. BaseProvider inherits BareProvider provides locale specific functionality. Functionality BaseProvider remains . Parent providers error try init . Locales inherit Parent provider, giving us ability customize every locale (needed) without changing logic locales. Every provider (locales) least en_US locale. Ability create specific functions locale specific provider. Example: first last names used locale? can now create specific functions locale. Example: Japanese locale now first_kana_name (example ヒロキ), last_kana_name functionality next romanized names. locales labels connected docs. can now see NZ Providers one overview.

Reworked development vignette added locale-templates addresses, colors, company, internet, job, lorem,person, phonenumber ssn. added following functionality fraudster: address, company, element, element_symbol, file_name, email, url, mac_address, lorem_paragraph, ssn add print method providers print nicely console. data fields moved private reduce visual clutter. Added docs languages like czech-language turkish-language. modified tests work test_that version 3
